intro: Globba regalis, commonly known as the royal globba, is a herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes ginger and turmeric. The plant features erect, sword-shaped leaves and produces clusters of showy, orange-red flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Globba regalis is also valued for its aromatic rhizomes, which have been used in traditional medicine.
